intro: Hibbertia exponens, commonly known as the yellow hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Hibbertia exponens thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
